intro: Capsella bursa-pastoris patagonica, commonly known as the Patagonian velvetleaf, is a variant of the common weed known as shepherd's purse. It is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae, characterized by its distinctive triangular seed pods. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and is native to South America, particularly Patagonia. It has small, alternate leaves and produces white or pale yellow flowers. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in ecological and agricultural studies.
